Re ''A Political Babe'' (Op-Ed, May 1): Like Pat Schroeder, I, too, tired of questions about my hair and clothes when I was on the campaign trail.

However, like most women, President Barbie is more than her appearance. She also has brains. She was a professional basketball player, a surgeon and an airline pilot before becoming an astronaut. With a resume like that, running for president was a natural next step.

If Barbie can get little girls to think about the opportunity for leadership in sports and in science, why not politics? The White House Project, the organization devoted to getting a woman in the White House, teamed up with Mattel so girls can begin to have a vision of women in the nation's top political job. If girls learn at a young age that they can be president, maybe they'll also grow up believing they will be.
GERALDINE A. FERRARO Arlington, Va., May 1, 2000
